summary: Axel and Maxence are the kind of representation that we need (I am not talking about their sexuality). They use this new...
body:
Axel and Maxence are the kind of representation that we need (I am not talking about their sexuality). They use this new platform that they have to spread a positive message and to help others in any way they can. They inform themselves about their characters and why this kind of stories are important to tell.

Honest and kindly people is the way to go.

tags: i never want to get involved in drama
but yall be testing my patience
why are people CONSTANTLY complaining and looking for bad intentions everywhere
try to understand and educate instead please
summary:
once again people are taking shit out of context and blowing it to stupid porpotions YES, max said 

 it's okay if straight...
body:
once again people are taking shit out of context and blowing it to stupid porpotions

YES, max said it’s okay if straight people wanted to play gay, bi, and trans people to show their support to the lgbt+ community, and he said it to reinforce the idea that it should NOT BE A PROBLEM for anyone to have to play an lgbt+ person even if they’re not lgbt+ themselves, which involves kissing people of the same sex, etc

NO, max is not a transphobe (he’s been clearly showing his support for the lgbt+ community WTF), but is MAYBE (maybe as in we don’t know for sure, so let’s not assume) not well informed about the fact that many openly gay actors and trans actors have trouble finding acting jobs other than for gay/trans characters (and many times it’s cishet people who take on those roles)

so, can the people who have been posting shit about him being transphobic chill the fuck out for a minute and stop looking for bad intentions everywhere? have you always been well informed about every social issue we have? shouldn’t we be aiming to educate people with respect (especially someone like max) instead of throwing hate around like every other asshole in this world? 

isn’t skam about educating everyone on social issues and stigma?

summary: I know what Maxence said was wrong and he should be properly educated on it, but I can’t help but think that people are just...
question: I know what Maxence said was wrong and he should be properly educated on it, but I can’t help but think that people are just going to send him hate and cancel him now since cancel culture is so big. I also don’t think he meant any harm with what he was saying, but it was ignorant and he should learn. Basically, I’m a little nervous for all the hate he’ll receive.
answer:
Hi babe,

Let me just start off with in regards to people sending him hate and canceling him: I sure hope not! Also, I don’t think he said it maliciously either. It was ignorant but it’s not the end of the world. People can totally leave comments, or send him messages, in a respectful way to educate him on what he said and give him their pov without having to be hateful. I hope people realize this.

Let it become a teaching moment. Cancel culture is so toxic in itself.

summary: For the past month I was so damned impatient for every clip to drop.
body:
For the past month I was so damned impatient for every clip to drop.

But now that there’s only one episode left and it’s all good stuff… I’m just like…. Nah..take your time. I’m good… Give it to me…but not too fast. I want this week to last.

tags: i was doing a face mask in case you're wondering where that came from
summary: i can totally see lucas coming home from school one of these days to find mika with a face mask on which okay not that unusual...
body: i can totally see lucas coming home from school one of these days to find mika with a face mask on which okay not that unusual just to walk into eliott with a face mask on as well and his hair pushed back in a sort of hair band and him going “eliott, mon amour, you know you can say no to the things mika suggests, right?” and eliott giving him a questioning look and saying “what?” while smiling and then lucas asking mika why does he make everyone do these kind of things just to hear him saying “chaton, that was your boyfriend’s idea” and when lucas looks increduly at eliott eliott just shrugs and goes “how do you think my skin always looks good, lulu?” and raises his eyebrows in true eliott style™ and lucas just shakes his head and smiles deciding that okay maybe he should try one later

tags: am i gonna get hate? let's see
this is not a CANCEL HIM or HE'S PROBLEMATIC post
y'all need to stop awarding people ally ribbons for doing literally the barest minimum
summary: oh maxence..... honey. gosh, that comment about straight actors beings able to play gay, trans, bi roles..... tone-deaf and a...
body: oh maxence….. honey. gosh, that comment about straight actors beings able to play gay, trans, bi roles….. tone-deaf and a tad ignorant. i lov him but boy does he need to be,,,,, like more nuanced and less “it doesn’t matter!! we’re all the same!!!” in his approach. that’s like, not even good allyship, babe. that invisibilization that cis white people do to make things easier for themselves. it’s….. not that simple. it shouldn’t be simplified. ofc i appreciate his dedication to eliott and his role, and i do think it’s good that he speaks out about this stuff, but some of the stuff he says,,,, needs to be more thoroughly thought out.

summary: BTS from David’s Instagram - March 24 According to the saying, “you always make the same film”, and until recently I had always...
caption:
BTS from David’s Instagram - March 24

According to the saying, “you always make the same film”, and until recently I had always taken it with a grain of salt. But for this scene, I can only face the facts.

In 2013 I directed “Rien ne peut t’arrêter” (Nothing can stop you), the first of my short films to be produced, in which Lucie (!?) broke into a desperate run against fatality, crossed the wall of time and found her dead love in a parallel reality (!?). As a kid, I had thought for a long time that I could “catch up with” by deceased loved ones by running as fast as I could, and my screenplay was a translation of that hope. If the film was an unforgettable key point in my quest to one day become a director, I was always frustrated by the fact that I couldn’t sufficiently develop the love story that led to this spectacular run…5 years later came Skam France and the adaptation of this famous “O Helga Natt” moment. Watching the wonderful original scene, reading Fanny Talmone’s script and listening to “Remember” by Seinabo Sey showed me the obvious: what could be stronger to reunite Lucas and Eliott than to relive with Lucas all the key moments in their story between each breath of a run charged with love? It all fit. Xavier, Rémi and Axel knew how crucial this moment was for me, and we prepared very carefully. From our first preparatory meeting, I had asked this question to my little one: “Can you run before it is too late?”. He had nodded, surprised but instantly understanding the intention of the moment. Every look, every gesture had to translate that urgency.

And he ran, so strongly and so fast that the first take was a failure, the minivan having spent 75% of the time…catching up to him. Back to the start, I had called out to him “Hey, Lulu, can you slow down a little pls?” and the little one had answered “Before it’s too late, David! I have to find him!” The message was clear, it was our job to match his intensity. And Lucas won over everything, starting with the little boy that I was who believed strongly that love always wins…and you all.

According to the saying, “you always make the same film”, and until recently I had always taken it with a grain of salt. But for this scene, I can only face the facts.

In 2013 I directed “Rien ne peut t’arrêter” (Nothing can stop you), the first of my short films to be produced, in which Lucie (!?) broke into a desperate run against fatality, crossed the wall of time and found her dead love in a parallel reality (!?). As a kid, I had thought for a long time that I could “catch up with” by deceased loved ones by running as fast as I could, and my screenplay was a translation of that hope. If the film was an unforgettable key point in my quest to one day become a director, I was always frustrated by the fact that I couldn’t sufficiently develop the love story that led to this spectacular run…5 years later came Skam France and the adaptation of this famous “O Helga Natt” moment. Watching the wonderful original scene, reading Fanny Talmone’s script and listening to “Remember” by Seinabo Sey showed me the obvious: what could be stronger to reunite Lucas and Eliott than to relive with Lucas all the key moments in their story between each breath of a run charged with love? It all fit. Xavier, Rémi and Axel knew how crucial this moment was for me, and we prepared very carefully. From our first preparatory meeting, I had asked this question to my little one: “Can you run before it is too late?”. He had nodded, surprised but instantly understanding the intention of the moment. Every look, every gesture had to translate that urgency.

And he ran, so strongly and so fast that the first take was a failure, the minivan having spent 75% of the time…catching up to him. Back to the start, I had called out to him “Hey, Lulu, can you slow down a little pls?” and the little one had answered “Before it’s too late, David! I have to find him!” The message was clear, it was our job to match his intensity. And Lucas won over everything, starting with the little boy that I was who believed strongly that love always wins…and you all.

answer: Ugh, so that is what he posted. I saw that yeah. Axel is really out there doing the most. Go off, king.
